Reviews.Title: “Two stars...you can do so much better.”
Reviews.Author: Nepsaevoli
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this hotel. The photos had me convinced it might be a value, however I have certain needs. Free internet indicates there will be internet. At times I had two bars but couldn't maintain a connection. Staff was gracious and let me out of the remainder of my stay. There is also a dangerous trip hazzard entering the bathroom. The stone is 2" high and a bummer when you hit it with your toe in the middle of the night. Room was depressingly dark and drab. View was pathetic. Lastly, you need to ask for a lock for the safe, as they do not voluntieer it. I went to the trouble of moving because it just fell too far short of my expectations. Master suite is small and chopped up. Think about your worst New York City hotel experience. Yea...thats what I mean. Staff was very sweet, but.......

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MarkRyder
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, not your average Holiday Inn. Fantastic large rooms, nice amenities and staff that couldn't be more helpful and friendly. Breakfast nice and in a palatial room! Location is excellent with lots of dining and shopping options nearby. Taxi's are the best option for getting around as they are so cheap. Metro stop is only 5mins walk away, however it was quite uncomfortable to use, even out of rush hour as when I tried it mid-afternoon I had to wait a couple of trains before I could even get on, and then it was a mad-crush.

Reviews.Title: “Not noisy at all and in great locale”
Reviews.Author: LovesToTravel2_11
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about staying at this hotel as I had read the reviews about the noise. We had room 208 and it was not noisy at all. The desk and bell staff was excellent. The room was large and comfortable with two queen beds, 2 desks, and a sofa. The restaurant was good with very helpful and friendly staff. I would rate the breakfast buffet much better then the lunch buffet. Note that the entrance to the hotel has a very steep staircase and I did not see en elevator, so call ahead. We requested and received an excellent driver/guide (Jose) at a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Stay for First Visit to Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights and it took a day or two for me to appreciate the place. Even though I travel quite a bit, I was a little overwhelmed by my first visit here. Check in was quick and easy. Staff was professional if not overly friendly. (This seems true of all Holiday Inns everywhere I go, usually professional but never really friendly) They knew enough English to communicate with me, but as I discovered everywhere else I went in Mexico City, English is not really spoken that much here). I had a King Master Suite which was huge and really comfortable. I especially loved the big new walk in shower. Although there were two sofas in the living area that really need to be put out to pasture, everything else was in good condition. They still have the old tube TVs though (Room Tip) I did notice that if I was in the living area close to the front door of my room, all the hallway noise was magnified because of the tile floors in the hall, luckily my bedroom was set back, so I never heard anything while sleeping, so think about upgrading to a suite. Maid service was excellent and always respected my do not disturb sign. (I'm a late sleeper!) I had breakfast in the hotel every morning, I have to say for hotel food, it was excellent and actually cheap for a hotel. I think they have room service because I saw trays in the hallway, but for some reason they ripped the menu pages out of my room guide. The location which at first put me off, turned out to be very good. It's on the edge of the Zona Rosa. About a 10 minute walk from the all restaurants, bars and clubs in a quiet little neighborhood. There is a music school across the street (my room was facing it) and I woke up to some nice live music every morning. Small shops and a 7-11 very close by. Public transportation, the metrobus and the metro are easy to walk to from here. But if you like to walk and don't mind a good healthy hike, I discovered that you can walk to the Zocalo, Chatapultec Park, La Condensa and many other sites from here. This really was a nice suprise as I like to walk and discover cities this way. I did try to use the"Fitness Center" one night, but really, this was kind of a joke. 3 pieces of equipment with no water and no bathroom is not a fitness center. Also, the remote controls for the TV and the AC were missing. You really need to be determined to work out to use this place. But if you go outside of the fitmess center they do have a really nice rooftop balcony next to it. At check out I asked for a taxi to the airport and they had a guy in an old van waiting for me. Luckily, by this time I trusted the hotel staff enough, so I went right in. Only 200 pesos, and the driver was very nice (Dressed in a suit). Although the van was a little bit scary. The hotel should probably re-think this option. After spending a whole day exploring the cacophony of Mexico City, I came to really appreciate being able to return to the quiet and comfortable hotel

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: Dooglas
Reviews.Content: The location in the middle of the Zona Rosa is excellent. The rooms are large and comfortable. The orientaton around a central courtyard results in reasonably quiet rooms in the middle of a bustling city. The front desk staff was helpful but had limited English skills to assist first time visitors to Mexico City who have limited capability in Spanish. There is a convenient restaurant in the hotel and many more good choices in the immediate area. Access to cabs is good and we were able to arrange a day trip to Teotihuacan with no difficulty.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and service”
Reviews.Author: cewjkb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the middle of the Zona Rosa. The area is very secure with numerous bars and restaurants. It is an easy walk to Reforma. There are countless 7-11s if you need anything and several Starbucks. The staff are very helpful and friendly. I inadvertantly left my safe open one day and upon return found everything still sitting in there down to the last penny! I can't recommend this hotel highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Large room in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: gl0betr0tter_dc
Reviews.Content: Stay in room 602. It is very big and quiet with a great terrace. We had great service from the bellboy. Check-in was a bit slow, probably because of the bicentennial. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: BigBarney1968
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect. There was lots to do at night close by. Lots of good restaurants close by too. The food at the hotel was good but along with the room was quite expensive. Service was what you expect from a hotel at this price level. I would recommend this place to anyone who does not mind spending a little extra.

Reviews.Title: “So far so good!”
Reviews.Author: theycallmearex
Reviews.Content: Been here two nights and so far it's been great. The locale take a bit of getting used to, but otherwise, it's perfect. Professional staff and even a 7-11 at the corner for easy bites.

Reviews.Title: “Most Likely Last Time For Me In This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pharo68
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several Holiday Inn hotels around the world. This was pretty bad all the way around; parking was a mess, checking in was slow and tedious, the A/C in my room did not work (I was offered a different room on the first floor which I was informed would be a bit noise, I chose to sweat it out), the TV did not work, and the breakfast we ordered was average at best, and the printer in the BC did not work (trying to print out my bording pass). Since there are plenty of good, economical choices for hotels in this city, I am fairly sure I wonâ€™t be back here anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel that i'v visited”
Reviews.Author: RogerFer
Reviews.Content: The service at my check inn was the worst experience there was some person Miss Favela, no english spoken and too lack on her guest experience so rude on her spoken way and behavior. But i canÂ´t imagine this!!! A general manager drunk? Please check this hotel because could generate some problems for this kind of persons to guests. I've stayed in other Holiday Inn around the world and I can't imagin that i''l find this in Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location”
Reviews.Author: viajera-mx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel often when it was the old 'Vasco de Quiroga', before it was taken over by Holiday Inn, so were expecting to make wistful comparisons. But the hotel -- design, layout, service, everything -- is wonderful! It's true that the restaurant is a bit expensive, but there are tons of options for dining (including a nice supermarket with a great bakery) in the immediate vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: RichardSCalgary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Zona Rosa during a recent visit to Mexico City. We booked 2 junior suites for 3 nights through the Holiday Inn website. Holiday Inn confirmed a 14 day advance purchase (non refundable) nightly rate of $90 US, plus tax for each room, based on 4 people in 2 rooms. The hotel is in a good location, on a relatively quiet street, just on the edge of Zona Rosa. The hotel appearance and general amenities are what we usually expect from a Holiday Inn although, in this case, somewhat worn and dated. The front desk service was poor and at times both understaffed and chaotic. We found it difficult to impossible to communicate in English, often depending on a Bellman for translation. The air conditioner did not work in one of the two rooms we were given. The next day we requested a repair. When we arrived at our room that evening there was still no air conditioning. The room did not have screens on the windows. When we opened a window for air, we were swarmed with mosquitoes throughout the night. The next day we requested a change of rooms and did have a decent rest on the third night. When we checked out we discovered that our credit card had been charged a room rate that was more than 30% higher than the rate Holiday Inn had confirmed. We were unable to communicate effectively with the front desk in English, and left with the matter unresolved. Since then we have had four separate communications with Holiday Inn Reservations and Guest Relations over a period of 2 weeks. So far the hotel has not honoured the confirmed reservation and Holidy Inn has been ineffective in dealing with our concerns. There are numerous hotel choices in Zona Rosa, and we will never stay in this hotel again. We would also caution travelers using the Holiday Inn reservation system. It does not appear they are able to back up their promise of 'Reserve with Confidence' .

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel- staff issues”
Reviews.Author: ETA_Unknown
Reviews.Content: Nothing wrong with the place- your typical Holiday Inn with a nice Mexican feel. Stayed one night and had constant issues with front desk staff: left hand does not know what right hand is doing from processing pre-paid reservations to arranging airport taxis. The latter seems to be a common front desk operational issue judging by the facial expression from senior management who asked how things were going.

Reviews.Title: “Not your father's Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: baltoteach
Reviews.Content: This past June, my wife and I with another couple stayed at the Holiday Inn in Zona Rosa. I was a little worried given that my only other experiences with Holiday Inn were comprised of nights stayed when I was a kid. This place was updated, stylish and centrally located. Our nights were comfortable with a sitting area that gave the four of us a chance to debrief the day's events. The staff were incredibly helpful and considerate. The food at the restaurant found within was a bit overpriced but that should be expected from a hotel dining area. Overall, we really enjoyed ourselves and if traveling to the city again, would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: rephello
Reviews.Content: Drop your notion of tacky Holiday Inns. This place is classy. The colonial-modern design is a delight to the eye, and during my stay, there were various local artists works featured throughout the hotel. Magnificent sculptures and intriguing mixed media works festooned the walls of a place that managed to be both classic and modern at the same time. The wooden doors to the hotel are 20 feet high and must weigh a ton each and give an immediate sense of history and security as well as beauty. The hotel was tastefully decorated for Christmas using pointsettias and subdued holiday adornments. The staff at the hotel match the sophistication, eclecticism and beauty of the building itself. They are friendly, diverse, and painstakingly caring about their guests. Minutes after they showed me my room which was large and beautiful and had a view of the fountained courtyard, they called to offer me another room since there was a party booked in the restaurant for the evening and they were very concerned that I would be disturbed. I elected to keep the room since I liked it so much, and I could sleep through a trainwreck if need be. The party ended earlier than they expected and the noise that came from it was minimal. Caudia and Vincent (sp?) were especially helpful throughout my stay. I had room service at the hotel a few times. The breakfasts were very good. The menu, however, lacked snack-hors d'oevre items which was a problem since the magnificent room inspired me to entertain fellow travelers. I ordered cookies and coffee for one guest and the cookies weren't very good. The coffee could take a lesson from Starbucks as well. The shower was large, marble, beautiful and powerful. The bed was large with lots of pillows and firm yet comfortable. The internet service was included at no additional charge. I would not hesitate to stay here again. I also enjoyed being only a few blocks away from the clubs and fun in the Zona Rosa. This was my first trip to Mexico City and I was surprised and delighted at every turn. The people in the city are warm and genteel. I always felt respected and validated and never once felt mistrustful or threatened by anything. The city is wondrous and second to the living-breathing descendants of its rich history are the cultural venues wanting exploration. My only regret is that I only had 3 days. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Zona Rosa Staff & Paola”
Reviews.Author: fr_lopez
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Holiday Inn Zona Rosa was one of the highlights of our stay in Mexico City. The staff was friendly and helpful. The food was good in the restaurant. The price was great. The rooms were great. However, I would be remiss in not saying that Paola who is one of the managers at the Holiday made our stay even better. Like many tourists we were feeling a little annoyed at the many drivers and tours that take advantage of the tourist. Once Paola got involved and set us up with a guide and driver named Gerrardo. Gerradrdo picked us up and gave us whatever we needed. My next trip to Mexico City will certainly include the Holiday Inn Zona Rosa. F. Lopez

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: magoorx
Reviews.Content: We stayed with another couple at this hotel in for 3 nights in June. Our room was on the 6th floor & it was considered a suite (Two double beds & a sitting area with 2 couches). The room was very large & the four of us were more than comfortable. I agree with the below poster... the hotel was indeed quiet & was located in a fine area. We shopped at the grocery store (Sumesa) across the street & two nights brought back chips & beverages to enjoy in the air conditioned room. We enjoyed a tasty breakfast in the hotel one morning. It was definately priced as a "hotel breakfast"... but the food was good & helped with our time schedule. Overall the staff were helpful. I am a "gringo" who is fluent in spanish... I don't know if that won me more helpfulness or not. We used the business center for internet access. Even though it stated that the first 30 minutes are free & a charge is applied afterwards, never once did the staff spy & monitor our usage. The nearest subway (Cuatehmoc) is about 10 minutes walk. This was a safe walk for the four of us... we never felt threatened. We did this walk from daylight hours up until 9pm one night. The hotel gave us late check-out & stored our bags on the final day as our flight did not leave until late.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and safe”
Reviews.Author: Export_Sales_Manager
Reviews.Content: All these write-ups( including of course mine )are very subjective. It always depends on what you want, expect, see as a problem or not. This hotel is quiet - for me that's top class - and in a safe location. The staff I met were freindly and useful. The rooms are really far too big for me. High-speed internet very useful though. A little gym with a treadmill helps me, otherwise I can't see much of a better place to stay - and especially for the price. The bars and cafes etc round about are not to my liking - the Zona Rosa is very touristy, the food over-expensive and with poor service, so go somewhere else in a taxi. Or if you like walking I made it to the historical centre nice and easy and to the Anthropological Museum in about 3/4 hours stroll along the Paseo de Reforma. Saves the unnecessarily expensve taxi outside the hotel - just walk a bit along the road and take a normal one - half the price - if you need one. I shall stay here again after experiencing many much dirtier, nosier and decrepit places here in D.F.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Vasco de Quiroga”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance stayed at this hotel in 2000 and we found the owner to be extremely helpful and humerous. The price was very good for the great location. Our room was really clean had hot water and telephone. We're going back there this year 2002 because of the great time we had there. We're from Australia so coming to Mexico was a huge culture shock. These guys at this hotel made it such an easy and smooth ride. I give it two thumbs up.
